Sentencas: Metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells are regarded as a new generation of SOFC devices.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The use of porous metal substrate provides a high mechanical strength of a SOFCs' support and lowers the cost of fuel cells.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: In this study, powders of PI600, 317L and 430L steel grades were used to prepare porous metallic supports.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: After sintering at different temperatures, their porosity and high temperature corrosion resistance were evaluated.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Cyclic thermogravimetric analysis, X-ray diffractometry and SEM imaging were used to describe properties of these porous alloys.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Electrical properties were studied for selected samples.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The influence of porosity on resulting properties was elucidated.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The porosity changes measured between oxidation cycles were presented.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Results showed that the properties of porous alloys differ significantly from those of dense ones.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The high temperature corrosion rate is high and is strongly influenced by the porosity level.
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Open porosity decreases rapidly upon oxidation at 800 degrees C. As an outcome of this study, the PI600 alloy performs best among those investigated; however, better corrosion resistant materials are needed for SOFCs' supports operating at 800 degrees C. (C) 2010
Titulo: High temperature oxidation of porous alloys for solid oxide fuel cell applications
